column4: I just plugged a serial ata HDD in my ubuntu server and turned it on, how can I browse to the disk ? Do I have to mount it first?
cheers lotuspsychje ill check it out
it depends on the type of harddrive connection, if you are talking about the location of the physical drive normal its /dev/sda* or /dev/hd* for sata or ide respectivly
or maybe you are talking about where you mount a partition
then its what i said first
use gparted to look at the partition of the disk, "sudo gparted"
it will also give you the locical names and physical names of the harddrive partions and the drives them selves
thanks. Ill try that out. I have been using the GUI version of gparted before
it is a much better idea to get to grips with the terminal interface and the parted tool, like te said
dont store all your movies on the same partition as the os is installed, when it breaks its easy to fix :-D
no, ill be storing it on the disk we're discussing right now
Just thought i would give you a heads up :-D
